glsa.title: cadaver heap-based buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: There is a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the neon library used in cadaver, possibly leading to execution of arbitrary code when connected to a malicious server.

background.p: cadaver is a command-line WebDAV client.

description.p: Stefan Esser discovered a vulnerability in the code of the neon library (see GLSA 200405-13). This library is also included in cadaver.

impact.p: When connected to a malicious WebDAV server, this vulnerability could allow remote execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running cadaver.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are advised to upgrade to the latest available version of cadaver.
